chapter.para: &MESH; gives customers the ability to interact with its APIs indirectly using tools such as:

section.para: &CFN; is a service that lets you create a template with all the resources you need for your application, and then &CFN; will configure and provision the resouces for you. It will also configure all the dependencies, so you can focus more on you application and less on managing resources.
For more information and examples on using &CFN; with &MESH;, see the &CFN; documentation.

&CDK; is a development framework for using code to define your cloud infrastructure and using &CFN; to provision it. &CDK; supports multiple programming languages including TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Java, and C#/.Net.
For more information on using &CDK; with &MESH;, see the &CDK; documentation.

The &MESH; controller for Kubernetes helps you to manage your &MESH; resources for a Kubernetes cluster and inject sidecars into pods. This controller is specifically for use with &EKS; and allows you to manage your resources in a manner that is native to Kubernetes.
For more information on the &MESH; controller, see the &MESH; Controller documentation.
To see a guide on implementing &MESH; with &EKS; using the &MESH; Controller for Kubernetes, check out the &EKS; Workshop.
Terraform is an open-source infrastructure as code software tool. Terraform can manage cloud services using thier CLI and interacts with APIs using declaritive configuration files.
To see more about using &MESH; with Terraform, check out the Terraform documentation.
